chapter.title: BLFS Development
chapter.para: BLFS development takes place using three main systems. Firstly, the mailing lists blfs-book, blfs-dev and (to a lesser extent) blfs-support. Secondly the Bugzilla tracking system, and thirdly the CVS server where the book itself is stored. All of these services are provided by the server linuxfromscratch.org also known as shadowfax.linuxfromscratch.org or more usually, shadowfax. This single server provides mailing lists, web hosting, CVS hosting, ftp hosting, the Bugzilla system and basically everything we use to work on the BLFS project.

The actual BLFS book itself is written using Docbook-XML and at first can seem to be a daunting tangle of files. Basically, if you're confused, start by looking at index.xml. At the bottom, you will notice that it will reference the entity &book;. Look up the entity &book; and you will see that it points to the file book/book.xml. Continue in this way and you'll soon be finding your way around the book like a pro!
Anyone can subscribe to any of the mailing lists provided by shadowfax. I'm not going to describe that (or the lists in detail) here as there is a good description at .

The Bugzilla bug-tracking system for BLFS can be found at . In order to be able to add, remove and edit bugs, you need to add an account and make sure you are logged in whenever you wish to perform such an action. You can query and read the bug database without logging in or creating a user. Note that all bugzilla messages are copied to the blfs-book mailing list and that all editors should be subscribed to this and the blfs-dev list at a minimum.
Finally, there is the CVS server which will be discussed in the following chapters.
